channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road sweeping, 11th August
item.description:
Heathlee Road hasn’t been road swept since last year, it’s supposed to be done weekly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heathlee Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Construction fly tip, 11th August
item.description:
Received a reply stating this construction fly tip waste was collected . This has not been touched.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Institute Place, Hackney, London

item.title: Overgrown tree, 11th August
item.description:
The tree in the alley behind 15 Arlington Close, Sidcup DA15 8JW, in the winter the branch keep falling and cause damage to fences and getting dangerously high.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 281, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway increasingly overgrown, 11th August
item.description:
This pathway has not been weeded or cut back in months. This is now becoming a safety issue as it does allow you to see the other end of the alley/path when entering. Also, the branches growing into the path is providing hiding places for anti social behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 125, Pomeroy Street, New Cross Gate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Appalling Fly tip, 11th August
item.description:
Someone living in the flats on institute place moved out on Saturday and fly tipped all this furniture by the bins. Absolutely disgusting as they have put it all in the bins also. This block of flats need to be told off as it never ends.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Institute Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead badger found in garden, 11th August
item.description:
Dead badger found in garden. Placed it in black bag which is on the grass curb of Riverwood lane opposite side of the road sign.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riverwood Lane, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Overgrowth of base, 11th August
item.description:
Shrubbery around the base of trunk blocking drivers view when trying to come out of drives and also growing into pavement affecting pedestrians

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 281, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London

item.title: Morgan Sindall vans routinely stopping on Ilbert Street and leaving engines running., 11th August
item.description:
Morgan Sindall vans routinely stopping for long periods on Ilbert Street and leaving their engines running. Often happens several times per day. Morgan Sindall vans waiting for call outs or whatever. Drivers sitting in vehicles with engines running. No one specific vehicle but many MORGAN SINDALL vehicles - who have a contract with Westminster City Council so should definitely be abiding by the law against engine idling.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Ilbert Street, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Duvet blocking fire exit at montagu street, 11th August
item.description:
Duvet blocking fire exit of citipark at montagu street need to clear out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Montagu Street, Marylebone, London

item.title: Manager Simon Priscilla, Denise corbin, antisocial behaviour department, safer neighborhood police, the metropolitan police commissioner sir Mark Rowley can you please address this issue of anti-social behavior & criminal activity taking place at this address Leabank Square, London E9 5LP in the form of criminal group stealing motor vehicles dumping cars at this location,cloning vehicles, stolen vehicles,robberies, authority have a duty of care to residents and leaseholders and at the moment they feel unsafe with criminal activity taking place all over the Trowbridge estate for a number of years., 11th August
item.description:
Do not stay silent. ASB.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Leabank Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree, 11th August
item.description:
I have an overgrown tree at the side of my house. I’m concerned the tree could eventually fall due to badges sett being near by and undermining the tree.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brentwood Bypass, Brentwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Alley way needs cleaning and tree needs to be cut back, 11th August
item.description:
There is an alley way next to number 58 highland road, there is one down the side of the house and also one at the back of the house so people can access their gardens. These alley ways desperately needs clearing of rubbish and shrubs and there is a large tree at the back which is causing damage to number 58 garden fences and paving. photos will be sent via email and can this please be looked into urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highland Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped piano, 11th August
item.description:
Blocking pavement. Has been here for weeks now. People are beginning to break it up and vandalise it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Whiteley Road, West Norwood, London

item.title: Somebody has lost their number plate. Hackney Council this is not closed it has not been dealt with or investigated or cleaned up., 11th August
item.description:
Lazy Hackney Council closing reports and not dealing with the issues. Number plates steel laying on floor in bush lost number plates.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Fridge, 11th August
item.description:
Someone, presumably from the block of flats at Colebrook Rise, has dumped an old refrigerator on the grass by the public footpath. Aside from being unsightly this is a hazard for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): May's Hill Road, Shortlands, London
